alert.note: Alert for Custer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 22 at 4:52PM CDT until June 22 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN ELLIS...NORTHEASTERN ROGER MILLS...NORTHWESTERN CUSTER AND SOUTHWESTERN DEWEY COUNTIES... At 452 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles west of Harmon to 5 miles northwest of Angora to 3 miles west of Strong City, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Hammon, Leedey, Strong City, Roll, Angora, and Moorewood. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
